solved
I got the same thing when forcing OpenGL mode. Try removing that flag.
It's no good just posting that pic superm18, see the stickies for info on what you need to post to get support

I got the same thing when forcing OpenGL mode. Try removing that flag.

Awesome! thanks

KSP version: 0.90

Detailed explanation:got this wierd flikkering thing going on, happend after changing all the settings to max (never been a problem before)

Hmm, something is very much not right. It reports your local build ID as 297. Check that you're not running the 64-bit version and you're launching KSP.exe, nothing else.

Edit: Why is the upload date on that output_log from July?

Edited December 15, 2014 by Ted
Sorry superm18, turns out that -force-opengl and -force-dx11 are Unity3D issues that Squad can't fix, best you can hope for is that someone on the Unity forums has figured out a workaround.

Hmm, something is very much not right. It reports your local build ID as 297. Check that you're not running the 64-bit version and you're launching KSP.exe, nothing else.

Edit: Why is the upload date on that output_log from July?

must have gotten the wrong file, here it is: http://www./view/nr6z6eyqr949nk1/output_log(5).txt

It's a clean install and running 32 bit:

Sorry superm18, turns out that -force-opengl and -force-dx11 are Unity3D issues that Squad can't fix, best you can hope for is that someone on the Unity forums has figured out a workaround.

yes to bad, guess i need to cut back on the mods, ones they update
Isn't that just the launcher? Please try running the KSP.exe directly.

Isn't that just the launcher? Please try running the KSP.exe directly.

I never use the launcher, just started KSP up from steam without force openGL and changes settings like before, no problems

it's very much NOT resolved. You need -force-opengl on 32-bit or you can't run any significant level of modification. It was working just fine with 0.25 using -force-opengl, and now on 0.90 it's not. It's not a unity issue, or it would have been just as broken on 0.25. I'm having the same issue. If I run in windowed mode (alt-enter), then it's ok, but... In the absence of a working 64-bit build, we *absolutely must* have OpenGL mode working correctly like it did in 0.25.

it's very much NOT resolved. You need -force-opengl on 32-bit or you can't run any significant level of modification. It was working just fine with 0.25 using -force-opengl, and now on 0.90 it's not. It's not a unity issue, or it would have been just as broken on 0.25. I'm having the same issue. If I run in windowed mode (alt-enter), then it's ok, but... In the absence of a working 64-bit build, we *absolutely must* have OpenGL mode working correctly like it did in 0.25.

Actually unity received an update.

Something else maybe...Have you tried using the OpenGL switch along with the -popupwindow? Perhaps that will work since you say that windowed mode is working.

Cheers,

~Claw
I read that they didn't use the newer Unity for this release and we're still on 4.5.x - not true?

it's very much NOT resolved. You need -force-opengl on 32-bit or you can't run any significant level of modification. It was working just fine with 0.25 using -force-opengl, and now on 0.90 it's not. It's not a unity issue, or it would have been just as broken on 0.25. I'm having the same issue. If I run in windowed mode (alt-enter), then it's ok, but... In the absence of a working 64-bit build, we *absolutely must* have OpenGL mode working correctly like it did in 0.25.

It's very much a Unity3D issue: see their changelist for Unity 4.6.1

"OpenGL: Fixed fullscreen rendering on Windows." @ http://unity3d.com/unity/whats-new/unity-4.6.1

We'll have to wait until Squad can implement a Unity update.

got this wierd flikkering this going on, happend after changing all the settings to max (never been a problem before)

http://i.imgur.com/Kxls8DI.jpg

I had the same problem after I set Fullscreen = true in the KSP Settings. Set to False again solved the issue.

Hope it works for you as well...

I read that they didn't use the newer Unity for this release and we're still on 4.5.x - not true?

What KasperVLD said. However, I will say again to give OpenGL a try in borderless window mode by using the OpenGL command with the -popupwindow command. Many users are reporting success with this combo of flags.

Cheers,

-Claw
I'll try that. I notice that anti-aliasing isn't working either >< .... I *thought* 0.90 used the same Unity as 0.25 though? None of these problems existed in 0.25.

To my memory, the Unity build received a minor update for 0.90. Sadly, most of the bugs that turned up have actually been fixed on Unity's end, but we still have to wait until Squad can get a build of KSP running properly on the newer version of Unity.
